intro: Gnaphalium siculum, commonly known as the Sicilian cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Gnaphalium siculum is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
